data.title: Hidden message (updated)
data.solution:
number_lines = int(input())
message = str(input())
words = message.split()
for line_number in range(0, number_lines):
    answer = []
    for x in range(line_number, len(words), number_lines):
        a = words[x]
        answer.append(a)
    print(*answer)
data.statement: Given a message, print out the words alternately in [[n]] separate lines.

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: An interger [[n]] represents the number of lines needed to be seperated.
<<Line 2>>: A string.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a message, print out the words alternately in n separate lines.
Input
Line 1: An interger n represents the number of lines needed to be seperated.
Line 2: A string.
Output
n distinct lines.
Constraints
2 <= n <= 10
1 ≤ Length of the string ≤ 256
Example
Input
2
This If is you not are a reading very this good then way you to have hide done a it message. wrong.
Output
This is not a very good way to hide a message.
If you are reading this then you have done it wrong.
